personalInfo.education: University of Rhode Island (2001, Business Administration)

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditionally Exempt: 10th qualifier from Qualifying Tournament, Money List 61-100
tourBios.carHigh:
2012: Did not play on the Web.com Tour. Played on the eGolf Professional Tour, where he finished eighth on the money list, with $54,839 in earnings...Had six top-10 finishes, including a runner-up finish at the Southern Open, thanks to a second-round 59...Was also T4 at the Irish Creek Classic. 

2011: Played in 22 events and earned lone top-10 of the season with a T9 effort at the Price Cutter Charity Championship in mid-August. 

2010: Played 14 Web.com Tour events. Best performance of the year came in his first start at the Micheal Hill New Zealand Open, where he finished T47. 

2009: Finished the Web.com Tour season No. 61 on the money list, making the cut in 13 of 24 starts...Was T9 at the Chitimacha Louisiana Open after holding a share of the 18-hole lead...Finished T9 at the Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open. 

2007: Member of the Web.com Tour when he made nine cuts in 17 starts during his rookie season. His best finish was a T10 at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Invitational. 2002: Made six Web.com Tour starts during the season, with made cuts at the Dayton Open (T19) and the Knoxville Open (T58).

Misc: Has also played on the Tour de las Americas, Canadian Tour, New England Tour, Hooters Tour and the Golden Bear Tour.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: After receiving putting tips from New Englander Billy Andrade, won the 101st North and South Amateur Championship at Pinehurst No. 2 in North Carolina...Attended the University of Rhode Islandâthe only school that offered a scholarship. Winner of two collegiate tournaments, including the Atlantic 10 Conference Championship in 2000...Winner of the 2001 Players Amateur Championship and the 2005 Bermuda Open.
tourBios.personal: Attended a Florida boarding school for two years and during that time received occasional lessons from legendary instructor Bob Toski...Lists his heroes as the men and women overseas in the military who are protecting our freedom...Got his start in golf from his dad.

dyn.dynResults: He has finished 9th on the Web.com Tour 4 times.
